caption: I Visited this place for the first time today. The bagels were good. But certainly not worth the rudeness and unwelcoming attitude from the woman at the cash register. And as I expected, alot of people in the reviews seem to have had similar unpleasant experiences. she is RUINING THE BUSINESS REPUTATION .
Got a bacon egg and cheese on a bagel, it wasn’t very tasty. Tasted like old bacon grease, eggs were too dry and overcooked. Very disappointed, I heard the food here was good.
Been here several times: the bagels are amazing, but the people are often pretty rude. Hard to tell if it’s worth it.
Good bagels, sandwiches are really good. Only thing is delivery took a bit longer than expected.
Good food but don’t come here if you are in a rush slower than florida on a Monday morning
Good place for quick bite.
Good cold brew coffee. Food looked good, so I'll have to come back for breakfast or lunch

The woman at the front is consistently rude when you go to buy anything and the workers don’t wear their mask well, especially the woman who takes ur order, she doesn’t wear a mask at all. Also the pricing seems to be inconsistent.
My first New York bagel! And it was everything I wished for. Loaded with cream cheese and delicious if you're looking for a simple yet savory lunch
Good tofu cream cheese
I’ve ordered bagels here several times (both pickup and delivery), the orders have been prompt and correct. The sandwiches are fairly priced, but the bagels aren’t the best I’ve ever had.
Great food

Good bagels, if they can get your order right. My order has been wrong three separate times, and most recently, they gave my roommate attitude for THEM giving US the wrong order. Wont go back until they have a customer service overhaul - so probably never.

Pretty great food! Lots of variety. Bagels are tasty and freshly made. Will make you a sandwich anyway you like. So many different cream cheese varieties. The employees will question your choices sometimes and throw some sass, but I guess that’s part of the charm!
Great service
delicious food spl vegie grill sandvich .

Great food without a smile  I was recommend to try this place staying in the Brooklyn area for their lox cream cheese bagel. The food was top notch, fresh and really tasty at a decent and affordable price. However, the staff were not accommodating and quite rude without a hello or goodbye or even a smile. If its a friendly service and welcome you’re after with your morning bagel - this is not the place for you . If you want a quick in and out takeaway experience though with minimal human contact (probably for the best) the food is somewhat great
Best bagel in the area

You walk in and nobody acknowledges you. I was literally the only person in the store. I stood and read the menu for about a min or two. I asked the man by the register if they have oatmeal and without looking up, he says “NO”. So I walk toward the back and then he asks if he could put it in the microwave for me. I tell him no thank you. Stood there another min without anyone asking what they could get for me, so I walked out.
Disgusting food and an unfriendly woman  on a front desk .
Best bagels in the area!!!
Best coffee around!
Love this place. Bagel sandwiches/egg sandwiches are always good. Great cookies too and staff is always so sweet. Best service in person and delivery. ThanK you so much!
Disappointed!!! Worst place I’ve ever been. They let the delivery guys inside and let the customers wait outside in cold weather. Awful customers service as well.

Accessible location on Bushwick Avenue for breakfast from my place, and nice casual atmosphere at that. There is a few tables here to sit and stay a while, it's not your traditional bagel shop stand or deli. Wide menu selection and good quality/price ratio for food ! Nothing fancy, but it works fine for me
Great bagels. The only decent place in the area.
Fresh bagels.
Good bagels but horrible customer service. The brunette who works the front has the nastiest attitude.
Went for breakfast and it was pretty good. Paid $6 for and good portion of eggs, homefries, and toast. The coffee was very good.
Best muffins ever
Really fresh food here

Very rude. Argues with the customer. I wouldnt recommend this place to other customers.  Last time I order here.  Rohan manager was arguing with me for trying to place an order over the phone and saying I couldnt place an order after 3pm.

The staff here is unpleasant ans so slow. While there were more employees than customers, it still took them 10 minutes to take our order and 25 min to make a sandwich! We could see the sandwich seating on the counter and no one was doing anything. When the sandwich was finally ready the guy dropped it (!!) and had to make a new one. The bagel with cream cheese are good though. Coffee isn't great.
Guy at the check out doesn't seem very happy.  Bagels good.

The New Special breakfast bagel was amazing. The service was above amazing. I unknowingly overpaid and the guy behind the counter handed me back the amount with my sandwich. Good food and good people!
Nice bagels and ice latte
The staff is pretty rude and the bagels are way overpriced for what they are. Go to the deli down the street instead.
Disgusting stale baked goods. Don't even think about getting their old pastries. Never coming back.
Liked it. Had a Panini Sandwich & it was delicious. Has a very good variety of food options.  Clean place.
Horrible experience! Order came two hours late.
They have some cream cheese and salad options for bagels. I purchased a French toast bagel with vegetables tofu cream cheese. And a buffalo chicken salad with onion bagel. It cost $7.xx
Food is great but it is so popular there is always a line.
(Translated by Google) A good place to enjoy bagels  (Original) Une bonne adresse pour déguster des bagels
I love this lace. I took a bagel sandwich with an omelette and avocado and the french toast bagel for dessert. Will probably come again.
Very nice place. The bagels are super fresh and tasty. I love their cream cheese and lox. Will definitely come again!
Great food and service. The Nova Deluxe bagel is excellent! Will come again

I wish I could give this place zero stars. I will not be giving them money ever again. Today, the man taking my order asked me THREE times if I 'was sure,' that I wanted 2x egg whites. When I insisted I was sure (obviously) he told me deadpan "it's going to be expensive, so don't complain." I can't believe the audacity he had to be so rude to a customer. I have a feeling the exchange wouldn't have happened were I not a woman.

Environmental friendliness: C+, unfortunately there was plastic everywhere with no visible effort to reduce waste, package their products more sustainably, etc. Staff: B, nice but pretty disorganized. They struggled to ring me up correctly. Food and drink: A-, the bagel with lox was small but tasted decent. The coffee was OK as well. Price/Value: C+, in general it was pretty expensive. For the good we got, lox bagels and coffee, they were expensive. A lox bagel for 14.43 after tax isn’t ok when it was as small as it was. Even if it’s lox. Ambiance: B, just your typical bagel shop. Props for having outdoor seating.  I’d say do more to improve your carbon footprint, focus on improving your service, and lower your prices. I would not go back.
The bagel was just ok. But I loved the lox and scallion cream cheese!
Nice spot. Bagels were decent and the jalepeño cream cheese is real good.

I ordered from here and they took extremely long to deliver even though I just ordered bagels. On top of that they gave us the wrong order. When I called back, initially they hung up on me and I had to call back again. I called back a second time and explained the situation and then was put on hold for 5 mins before they asked me my address. After they received my address I was very rudely hung up on again. I have yet to receive my order that I paid for.
A bit pricey but good bagels

Avoid this place!! Way better bagel shops nearby where you don’t wait half an hour for your food for no reason. They made jokes about how slow they were making orders too!! Horrible customer service. I had ordered two dry bagels in a bag and 7 people after me were served before me. And had things like egg sandwiches so I was waiting over 25 minutes! She made my iced coffee way early and it sat there melting behind her - since she made me wait - and tasted horrible by the time I got it. Not worth the high prices AT ALL!!
Overpriced. They didn't toast my bagel, and so it was just gross with the tofu. Cranky customer service too.

The manager or owner who is operating this place exhibits childish and beyond disrespectful behavior. I placed an order at 6:34 AM and waited over 90 minutes after the order did not come. I called to check in and he said his driver did not show because of the trains. I told him I get it; however, it was unacceptable to not call and let me know that there would be a delay due to his faulty operations. He told me that he's tired of people telling him what to do and that I would not get the food and that my order is cancelled and hung up.  This is completely unacceptable and I am filing multiple complaints with Seamless, BBB, and will continue to voice my concern for childish and unprofessional behavior.  It’s a good thing I got plenty of sleep last night because I am fully motivated.

Got a salad here through Seamless, absolute joke ! So distasteful,  they didn’t put half the things in that I requested . The protein I added in was boiled eggs it was grey And oldish looking and there was barely any. I selected whole wheat bagel and they sent a regular one without updating me . All going straight into the garbage what a waste of time and money.  When I called they couldn’t care less how they messed up.
(Translated by Google) Super nice and delicious breakfast place!  (Original) Super leuke en lekkere ontbijtplek!
Cute and wide variety on menu. A bit pricey given the quality
Very rude staff! Didn’t want to deliver to Bushwick Houses Development. Meanwhile it’s 3 blocks away- Don’t open stores in our neighborhoods when you cant serve the people in them! terrible!

👍Only here a few days googled breakie to go near Me this place popped up said 5 minute walk thought lets give this place a try The Spanish Omelette with Jalapeno, Cilantro, Red Onion, Cheddar and Mozzarella was beaut came with toast #Bonus

Unfortunately I cannot recommend this place. Overpriced and staff is extremely rude, fighting with each other and arguing with me and other customers in front of me (including NYPD officers). Take your business elsewhere!

Extremely rude staff, sigh, and eyerolls when order was being taken. Food was not done well. Ordered a bacon egg and cheese on an everything bagel. Bread wasnt even toasted, the cheese was not melted and the bacon was cold and felt like they cooked it the night before and left it out. This place is a nightmare. Bad service on multiple occasions. Stay away.
Rude, eye rolling and bit overpriced.
Best bagels on this side of Brooklyn. Friendly staff. Best of the Bread Brothers locations, for sure.

Plentiful choice of bagel breads and toppings. Raw juicing was nice, doesn't off set the Kcals as it's a generous portion of creme cheese and your choice of bagel filling (vegan friendly). Popular for large catering . A handful of tables inside,there's a small wait but totally worth it.
Awesome bagel and they don't skimp on the cream cheese!
Amazing bagels and spreads.

Good bagels. The hispanic staff working there is extremely kind and good humored. The owner/register is usually not as nice at all and will sometimes try to sneak in random charges, or at least it seems. They make the billing quite confusing. The bagels are really good and they have a huge selection of different cream cheeses. I DO NOT recommend the rainbow bagel with funfetti! I got this as a one time thing to try it out and it was too wild for me. Everything else is amazing!
This is my semi daily breakfast go to. Guys are nice, bagels are top notch and the coffee is strong.

This place should not offer gf bagels at all, because their efforts are truly offensive. They charge over $6 for a gf bagel with cream cheese. The bagels are a disgrace, and what makes it worse, the entire staff says negative and rude things about the gf bagels.
Horrendous pitiful service and old bagels/cream cheese....
Gr8 bacon, egg & cheese wrap,, coffee is pretty good as well...
One of the best bagels in nyc
(Translated by Google) Good service  (Original) Buen selvicio

When the food order was already late, I tried calling them to see status. After three rings, no one picked up. I had to contact seamless in order to contact them. Seamless had trouble reaching them as well, but they apparently have alternate contact to reach out to. They said meal would get here in 5 mins. 20 mins pass and the food arrives...cold. We call seamless to complain, they reach back out to this place who refuses to refund. Will never buy here again. Buyer beware.
Building upon request
Rude staff, always getting sighs and eye rolls, prohibitive card minimum, cream cheese always tastes rotten. Gotten poor food and rude service too often. Not worth it
Overpriced
Overpriced and they never take pick up orders . Very Minimal Lox when you order a lox bagel. They also charge you for adding hazelnut or flavor to coffee. They nickel and Dime you .

Listen to the reviews (I know I should’ve)! Soggy bagel with barely any lox cream cheese. Asked for jalapeños thinking they were free, and one guy added them without telling me there were 1$ extra. The guy in the kitchen yelled over saying they were an extra dollar AFTER they’d already put them on. I didn’t want to pay for that, so they literally PICKED off the 4 jalapeño pieces they put on. Very much stingey and not customer oriented at all! Worst of all the bagels are NOT GOOD.

As a local I'm always horrified at how rude and terrible they are to what could've been a regular. They're always super stressed out and totally argumentative and brusque. They need to learn some manners.
Staff are lazy food pretty good prices too high
Great tasty and big bagels. I tried toasted sesame seed with butter cream cheese and jam.

MOST DISGUSTING PLACE AROUND. If you have any self respect, you will NOT go there. There are tons of other bagel places around. Bagels smelled like cleaning chemicals and bleach. Bread is full of MSGs and other unhealthy additives, made my stomach feel horrible. Prices are outrageously scammy and staff is rude. Total disgrace. Don't know how this hole stays in business
Bagel tasted old..cream cheese spread was good.. Very pricey for a bagel also.. behind the counter no one smiles ... wont be back.
The selection of bagels and cream cheeses is unsurpassed!!!! Just had jalapeño & cheddar cream cheese on an "everything" bagel and it was "da bomb!!!"

They wouldn't sell me the remaining pumpernickel bagels because of potential orders that may come through over Seamless. It doesn't make sense to hold onto bagels that might sell when I'm willing to give you money right now.
(Translated by Google) A normal place to eat.  (Original) Un lugar normal para comer.
Everytime I come in owner is yelling at his employees and customers. Yelled at one of his delivery guys to "learn better english" in front of a ton of customers. Awful service and food is mediocre.
Good food and service.
Best bagels you will ever eat. Very clean and mostly friendly. Food is excellent.
This Indian guy don't let the workers and the costumers speak Spanish bad experience with this person, hate people like this. Prices are too high.......
Always delicious!  Amazing bagel flavors, and cream cheese flavors. (And they have Cadbury Crunchie bars!)
Has so much variety of cream cheese flavors. So many to choose from. My fam and I come here all the time. Nice people.
Slow service and too expensive. Lower the prices.
Ordered an omelette, bit into a dirty used bandaid. Called Grubhub, they called the restaurant and restaurant didn’t care at all. this is disgusting.
Good breakfast
That bagel though!
Awesome vegan tofu "cream cheese" - better than the real thing! Walnut-raisin, scallion, veggie - yummy!
Friendly Service, Great Options.
They know what they did
Best bagel in East Williamsburg/Bushwick and probably even further. Friendly staff feels like family.
Really good bagels!!! A lot of cream cheese flavors. Helpful crew. They even have free samples! Try them out!
Great Bagels and breakfast deals. Worth the price

We just got a tea and a ginger shot. It was very strong and a kinda man helped us out he told us to mix the shot in the tea. I believe he was the owner because after his suggestion he handed us a sample of a very good and spicy green juice.
Snuck in an extra price for slicing the bagel that I took to go. Owners are rude and don't respect service dogs. Overpriced too
This shop has the nastiest and most disrespectful staff in the area. They should look at replacing their day staff.

Wildly, insanely, unnecessarily overpriced. 2 pancakes (meaning 1 order that came with literally 2 pancakes), 1 egg and cheese, 1 coffee and one plain tea cost $23. I don't know who these people think they are but that's outrageous. And no, the food isn't good enough to justify that price. Go to Jesse's across the street instead.
First time I ate a bagel, they have a lot of different types of Bagels and also different cheese and things to put in the bagels,  I like the experience. Very good taste. Good products.
my $12 my lox sandwich had a single thin slice of salmon
Check if your order is correct before you head home.
Awesome and delicious..Great staff

I don't tend to write reviews but my experience this afternoon at this place was so very disappointing. I doubt I'll ever go back. I've been once before and my sandwhich was made perfectly and correctly-- plus it was at such a great price, like less then $5. I decided to go back a week later and get the same sandwhich- not only did it cost twice as much ($10 this time- which seems like they make up the price). I told the lady, "are you sure it was half as much last week? She sorta just reread me my order and said yeah... so I paid it and getting home excited to at least enjoy my breakfast sandwhich I come to find it didn't have anything I asked for on it (sprouts, tomato, onion) besides the cream cheese and egg. So unfortunate.
Great NY bagel spot.
Good bagels and a good selection. The store is clean and the staff nice. I will go back again.

Bread Brothers Bagel Cafe recently replaced (or bought out) a previous bagel shop that left it's footprint in the form of rainbow bagels. Because there were so many tourists, they never seemed to care about getting an order right so I stopped going for two years and opted for a great spot on Havemeyer. Today, I had TWO bad impressions here. I stopped in for breakfast and ordered a bacon egg and cheese on an everything bagel with salt, pepper, and ketchup and asked for the bagel to not be cut (so the ketchup wouldn't make a mess). It's cut, there's no salt, pepper or ketchup and it tasted bland as hell. Moving on, I figured I'd give this place one more shot. So I ordered the Philly "Deluxe" from the grill menu later that same day. The Philly on the menu is priced at $5.99 and to "deluxe" it (side of fries) costs an additional $2.5. So I go to pay and I get charged 7.5 for the sandwich and the 2.5 for the "deluxe". I ask, why am I being charged more than what it clearly says on your digital menu. I'm told that they haven't gotten to update the menu prices yet (this place has been open for at least a week if not two now if not longer so who knows how many people are seeing prices for one thing and being charged differently). I said "never mind, just cancel it", mainly because I'm just urked at this place and how it seems no different than the last spot that was here. Dude's brand new to the register and says it's already been charged. I didn't feel like wasting his time when he doesn't know what he's doing anyway, so I just bite my tongue and wait. So, the Philly came out alright. Nothing great but not bad. It's exactly what I'd expect from a deli Philly. That said, I'm not coming here again. There goes another couple year boycott and a swift return to old reliable over on Havemeyer down the street. Ofc, telling everyone else who used to boycott this place because it seems like nothing has really changed. I can be pretty lazy so it takes a lot for me to get aggravated enough put up a neg review. Well done BBBC. 2 stars for getting 1 of 2 orders right while overcharging me and essentially telling me to deal with it. This is a place that heavily relies on it's location and tourists for business. The vibe I get here is that they couldn't give a rat- F* about anyone who ever comes in. Good luck getting any "regulars".

Think I have been here too many times. Every time it's same thing: Super slow service, even with no customers in the line (it takes them few min just to look in my direction), barely average bagels and of course 3 days old stoney cheese danish... If I ever come back here it will be sure sign that I'm developing some kind of memory loss.
SO SO RUDE! DONT SPEND YOUR MONEY HERE!
Crowded but fast and delicious
Good coffee and good bagels for a decent price. Some of the stuff might be a bit tense sometimes but I like them.

My experience here was the worse customer service I have ever experienced in my life! I cater to a company of 20 employees and called to place an order on Weds Mar 8 (yesterday) at 6:02am. The guy who picked up the phone YELLED at me and said they are not open (despite it being after 6am). When i asked him if he could take the order for me and I will pick it up in 20 mins, he got upset with me and hung up the phone. I will NEVER order from this place again and i hope you all don't either. The worse display of customer service I have ever received. I would spend at least $50 everytime I went now I will be going some where else.

Some of my favorite bagels in NY. They're always fresh and delicious and these guys carry like 12 different types of cream cheese / spreads. A bagel and cream cheese is typically less than $5 and it's a great bang for your buck.  Be prepared to wait on a weekend, but it's worth it. Also there's not much room to eat there, so I usually take them to go.
There is a lot of bagels options!
The bagels are so fresh you need to sit and enjoy...its my escape place

(Translated by Google) The bagel is delicious and the hot chocolate too. Many choices of cream cheese (it makes you want). Many choices anyway (omelette, sandwich ...). Not many tables to sit on the other hand!  (Original) Le bagel est délicieux et le chocolat chaud aussi. Beaucoup de choix de cream cheese (ça donne envie). Beaucoup de choix tout court (omelette, sandwich...). Pas beaucoup de tables pour s'asseoir par contre !
False they don't close at 9:00pm ...I was just here 7:37 pm and they already closed
One of the best bagels in town. Awesome staff!
As authentic a 'Bagel joint' can be in NYC
Hot bagels and ...
Bagels are pretty good but the coffee needs work
Great Bialys.
Very solid.
Cream Cheese with a real bacon... no brainer
Friendly staff. Good food. Huge portion for a low price.
They definitely do make good breakfast bagels with a decent price. Bagels are all made there and are much larger than normal size. Coffee wasn't too great though.
Fresh bagels with tofu options.
So good
Rude. Seems like the fact they are the only bagel places nearby makes them feel like they can treat people with disrespect
Ok bagels. The wait to order, wait to pay and wait to collect system was annoying.
Good bagels and the guys behind the counter are always super nice.
Generous folk
Nastiest cashier in the morning. Incredibly rude. Not coming back because of that.

Several months ago had a very bad experience. Lost my faith in people that day. We are a busy medical office and order frequently for the last 2 years from them. Never had a problem. Gave them great business. I was on a first name basis with entire staff, Chevy, Roy, Anton, etc. Well the drug companies buy us brunch about once a week and we send them to the 220 Bushwick location. The last time we ordered 3 of the lox bagel breakfast special which comes with salmon lox, cream cheese, tomato onion and capers. Apparently there was a mix up although i can't understand how it happened. When I got back to the office with the food we found 3 bagels, not toasted and with ONLY Lox, no cream cheese, no tomato, no onion and no capers. The real disappointment came when i called to explain to Roy what happened. I mean we are good customers. Well Roy was not very nice nor willing to rectify the mistake. He said, "Tony I can't do more than one bagel with Lox but the way he said it was not friendly. No apology no remorse. I did not go back for almost a month. I was honestly a bit embarrassed to go. I am not type of guy to beg for anything and i went simply to buy some food. Roy pulled me to the side and asked me why I didn't speak to him directly when this happened I couldn't believe he didn't remember that i HAD called him and his attitude was poor. Of  course I had already posted on the web site a review of what had happened and my feeling is that Roy read it and had a change of heart due to  bad publicity. So Roy pulls me to the side and i reminded him that he said he would give me a free bagel with lox made properly. He started preaching that he couldn't do anything as this had happened over a month ago and I didn't  notify him. Well I HAD spoken to him, I mean why would I NOT talk to a manager I knew well when something like that happened. He insisted i didn't speak to him so i simply said, "Well no more business from us I am not coming back" Chevy made a hurtful remark from behind the counter. He said and I quote, "Tony, we have a LOT of customers" obviously implying that my business would not be missed. Anton was apologetic and the short Spanish guy also apologized and they were both obviously feeling bad for me and how I was treated. Those 2 guys are very nice and know  how to treat people. Roy and Chevy can kiss my butt. So I left and Roy called me twice telling me i should have spoken to him when it happened  but he simply couldn't or wouldn't comprehend that I DID speak to him.One good thing came out of this. I changed my location and began to go to the Grand street branch. The manager is a doll. Knows how to treat people and has family working there who are super nice and they make GREAT food. Roy skimped so much on the Lox i had to pay 2 dollars extra to get a good sandwich but in the Grand Street location they don't skimp. Sandwiches are better and service is fantastic.Francis the manager bends over backwards to make everything perfect. So, don't you all think that if Roy's location screwed up 3 bagels with Lox they simply should have made them over? Instead i get nasty comments and backtalk and lies about how I mishandled the situation. I will be calling Daniel, one of the owners to advise him of this. Meanwhile Folks, Go to the grand street location near Bushwick ave and share a mile with Francis while she goes out of her way to make you a great sandwich. I'm so glad I went there. We gave them 160 dollars worth of business this week and well worth it. 0 stars for 220 Bushwick and 5 for grand street locale.

I lived for 6 months in NYC and this was by far the best bagel shop I visited.And I ended up going there every week. They have good prices, fresh dishes, good coffee and friendly employees. You will not be disapointed. Thank you! I wish there were bagels like this in Belgium.

I've only been here twice just to get a simple cup of coffee. On both occasions the person behind the cash register stared at me dead-eyed as I tried to order. "Perhaps I need to order through the sandwich line." I thought to myself. So I waited behind everyone ordering a sandwich. When I got to the sandwich counter and asked for a coffee the guy told me I should just order that at the counter. Welp back to the counter and I get the same dead-eyed stare. Thanks guys, great job.
This place has great bagels that are made fresh daily.
A nice place for breakfast.
Had the philly cheese steak with peppers. Nothing special. The bread was good though.

Pretentiously overpriced. Most sandwiches are around $8, which is crazy given how basic most of them are.  A yogurt parfait was $4.75.  Bagel with butter was $1.65, which is actually not all that bad when you consider that the bagel was thick and not too hard.  A hipster boy band was in town when I stopped by. Welcome to Bushwick, One Direction!!

Place could be so much better, the staff at night seems to be the best in town. The morning is a different story, the staff is beyond ignorant they get the order wrong more than half the time. You wouldd think if you order online you would get it right, but low and behold it's still wrong. I can walk in anytime in the evening and get what I asked for the first time and I dont have to repeat my self 3 times. Even tho I'm so upset with the way im treated in the morning im giving them 4 stars because the guys at night deserve it plus the food is amazing.
Good goat cheese&herb bagel, mediocre coffee. Prices are right.

The case of the missing french toast. Two hours of back and forth and nobody in the store could speak honestly as to the status of my delivery order, misleading me saying the order is out or will be out, different things every time I called...  Waiting after I finally get one of the guys in the store to make a new order and send it, 15 minutes later I get a call from the delivery guy. My thought-"Finally, my food is here!" I was wrong. The guy had called to inform me that he had already made that delivery to my apartment. To my apartment? That's impossible. Either he got the address wrong and somebody didn't care to correct them at the chance of a free breakfast, or the guy was lying to be ok with his bosses. Whatever the case, there was absolutely no need for a delivery guy to call my personal cel phone and insinuate dishonesty from my part.  Understanding there is no way I can enjoy a meal from these people after this, I called to cancel, not without first having to hear some empty apologies and lip service from the guy at the store. Bravo, Bread Brothers, for being my first ever customer review.
The breakfast platter is disgusting. Unseasoned home fries, cold turkey bacon. The sausage is a school round shaped patty. This is a joke smh STICK to bagels
Is good
Cross Contamination all over the store. Poor quality.  Horrible coffee
I love this place. I get the whole wheat everything bagel with tofu lox. They had almond milk for my coffee, and i had a great green juice. This is my early Saturday morning spot.

I work nearby and always order breakast from this pace. They do a really good job on my favorite Bacon Egg and Cheese Sandwich. The delivery is prompt and the prices are really suiting.  I really like their greek wrap for lunch as it's not a very big on the calories.
A very solid bagel spot and really the only place around so go hit it up!
